text: The San José de la Laguna Mission and Convento, in Laguna, New Mexico, dates from 1699. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1973, with note that it "is one of the best preserved buildings of its type in the United States. It retains most of the structures and artifacts which were placed in the Mission almost 300 years ago." View from side and rear It is an adobe building which was built under direction of Fray Antonio Miranda in 1699 and following years. With It is located on Plaza Road, at the south end of St. Josephs Boulevard, in Laguna.Google maps and satellite view ==References== ==External links== * Category:Spanish missions in New Mexico Category:Convents in the United States Category:National Register of Historic Places in Valencia County, New Mexico Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1699
title: San José de la Laguna Mission and Convento
